707548f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, north from East 25th (right) to 26th Streets, showing a clearance upon the former site of the Carl Shultz Bottling Plant. On the right appears a view eastward on the north sido of East 25th Street, to the East River, at which point is Pier No. 73. Buildings
shown are units of Bellevue Hospital.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707549f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., west side, from East 25th to 26th Streets, as seen from East 25th Street, and across clearance on the east side of First Ave. Shown at the S.W. corner of East 26th Street, is Bellevue Medical College.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen from East 26th Street.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
The structures, No. 429 and 431 First Ave., and No. 341 East 25th Street forming a corner plot at 25th Street will be demolished and their site utilined for a new annex to Bellevue Medical College according to building plans filed as noted in the Times of April
22, 1938.

707549f-a.text:
(1)
First Ave., west side, from East 25th to 26th Streets, as seen from East 25th Street, and across clearance on the east side of First Ave. Shown at the S.W. corner of East 26th Street, is Bellevue Medical College.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen from East 26th Street.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
The structures, No. 429 and 431 First Ave., and No. 341 East 25th Street forming a corner plot at 25th Street will be demolished and their site utilined for a new annex to Bellevue Medical College according to building plans filed as noted in the Times of April
22, 1938.

707550f-a.text:
First Avenue, from East 25th (left of No. 1) to 27th Streets, as photographed from the J. J. Little & Ives plant on East 24th Street. The Avenue runs through the darkened foreground area. The parking lot occupies the entire east frontage of the 25th to 26th Street block. On the right is the Out Patient Department of Bellevue Hospital. In the background of View 1 is the Empire State Building. View 2 has the 42nd Street-Grand Central 2one for a backdrop.
October 13, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707550f-b.text:
First Avenue, from East 25th (left of No. 1) to 27th Streets, as photographed from the J. J. Little & Ives plant on East 24th Street. The Avenue runs through the darkened foreground area. The parking lot occupies the entire east frontage of the 25th to 26th Street block. On the right is the Out Patient Department of Bellevue Hospital. In the background of View 1 is the Empire State Building. View 2 has the 42nd Street-Grand Central 2one for a backdrop.
October 13, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707546f-a.text:
First Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 25th Street, showing the newly erected Board of Health clinic. At the right is the adjoining Bellevue Medical College.
April 26, 1940
George D. Chinn

707547f-a.text:
(1)
First Ave., east side, north from East 25th Street, and showing Bellevue Hospital. Prominent building shown at the N.E. Corner of
East 26th Street, is the Out Patient Department.
April 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date. Note demolition of the former Carl H. Schultn Mineral Water Plant. Building under construction, will
provide new medical wards.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2, slightly more inclusive southward.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
